name: More Aussie Song Lyrics Quiz | International Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which now-defunct Aussie band sang the lyric, "Fame is notorious for causing stress"?
questions.explanation:
Baby Animals.

	From their first, self-titled album, the Baby Animals song "Rush You" was a huge hit for the band from Perth when it was released in August 1991.

questions.text: "Tell those girls with rifles for minds" was a lyric sung by which Aussie rock band?
questions.explanation:
The Church.

	Originally on their "Of Skins and Heart" album, "The Unguarded Moment" was a big hit in 1981 for the boys from The Church (also included on several other releases).

questions.text: A Melbourne based band, they sang the lyric, "I'm stuck between the devil and the deep blue sea."  Who are they?
questions.explanation:
The Living End.

	From their "Hellbound" album, the self-titled song "The Living End" was released in 1995. The band formed in 1992 with the name "The Runaway Boys".

questions.text: "Wading through overflowing reason, can't contain the feeling" was a lyric sung by which Aussie band from Violet Town?
questions.explanation:
Killing Heidi.

	Jesse and Ella Hooper form the hub of the band Killing Heidi. Their debut album "Reflector" made it to Number 1 Australia wide and earned them four Aria awards in 2000. The song these lyrics are from is titled "Heavensent".

questions.text: "She makes me sweat like it's a hundred degrees" was a lyric sung by which Aussie rock band?
questions.explanation:
Noiseworks.

	From their "Love Versus Money" album, "Hot Chilli Woman" was one of Noiseworks' biggest hits.  New Zealand born lead singer of Noiseworks, Jon Stevens, has performed with INXS.

questions.text: "Well we do the same things that we always do, nothing changes but the colour changes hue" is a lyric sung by which monumental Australian rock band?
questions.explanation:
Midnight Oil.

	From their 2002 album "Capricornia", Midnight Oil have another hit on their hands with "Too Much Sunshine".

questions.text: "Can you taste their lonely arrogance" was a lyric originally sung by which Aussie Rock band in 1982?
questions.explanation:
The Church.

	From their "The Blurred Crusade" album, "I'm Almost With You" was a hit for The Church in 1982.

questions.text: Who sang the lyric "Don't want to live in a smoking room"?
questions.explanation:
Midnight Oil.

	From their album "The Real Thing", the single "Say Your Prayers" was written by Jim Moginie.

questions.text: "If you leave me, can I come too?" was a lyric sung by which very unique Australian band?
questions.explanation:
Mental As Anything.

	With words and music written by lead singer Martin Plaza, this was a huge hit for this wonderfully zany Aussie band who debuted in 1977.

questions.text: "You think it's just a movie on silver screen" was a lyric sung by which Aussie band?
questions.explanation:
Skyhooks.

	From the "Livin' In the 70's" album, "Horror Movie" was just one of many huge hits for Aussie band Skyhooks.
